articles.description: All the latest football news and reaction to Thursday's Premier League win for Manchester City against Brighton, plus Premier League news conferences.
articles.title: Reaction as Manchester City beat Brighton to second in the Premier League & latest football news

articles.description: The Chicago Bears make quarterback Caleb Williams the first pick pf the 2024 NFL Draft.
articles.title: NFL Draft results: Caleb Williams picked first by Chicago Bears

articles.description: Joel Embiid scores 50 points in Philadelphia's 125-114 win over the New York Knicks despite dealing with Bell's palsy.
articles.title: NBA: Joel Embiid stars for Philadelphia 76ers after Bell's Palsy diagnosis

articles.description: Brazil's all-time record goalscorer Marta says she will retire from international football later this year.
articles.title: Marta: Brazil legend to retire from international duty

articles.description: The manner of Manchester City’s demolition of Brighton sounds an ominous note for anyone wishing to wrestle away their crown, writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: Manchester City: 'With Premier League title in sight, City rarely show any weakness'

articles.description: Arne Slot confirms that he is interested in becoming Liverpool's manager after Jurgen Klopp leaves at the end of the season.
articles.title: Liverpool: Feyenoord boss Arne Slot confirms he wants Anfield job

articles.description: Nico Hulkenberg has agreed a deal to join Sauber from Haas for the 2025 season.
articles.title: Nico Hulkenberg to join Sauber from Haas in 2025

articles.description: New DP World Tour chief Guy Kinnings says "there is no reason why players who have taken LIV membership could not qualify or be available for selection".
articles.title: Europe Ryder Cup eligibility for LIV players 'does not need to change' - DP World Tour chief

articles.description: Martin Odegaard is proving a shining example for his team-mates as he looks to captain Arsenal to a first Premier League title in 20 years.
articles.title: Martin Odegaard: How Arsenal captain has led by example

articles.description: Rafael Nadal begins his Madrid Open farewell with a comfortable straight-set win over American teenager Darwin Blanch.
articles.title: Madrid Open: Rafael Nadal begins farewell with straight-set win
